page.title: 20CREDITS
page.content: Problems have been overcome, to some extent, in this project in that precise wording has had to be used in order not to misrepresent facts about the area. The limit of our assignment cut halfway through the Village of Bowerchalke. Thus, the Public House, Baptist Church & Trout Farm were all excluded, and each contributes significantly to Village Life. Credit is due to all the Farmers, a Forest Ranger & a Church Warden: people freely gave us facts and expressed their attitudes & concerns.The BOWERCHALKE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE has undertaken this project in their Diamond Jubilee year - Jane Jenkin, Mildred Shayler, Louisa Jones. We acknowledge the help of Paul Turner, Lecturer, Salisbury College of Technology, for his assistance in using the computer.
